docs.lead_paragraph: Medicare has tentatively decided not to pay for virtual colonoscopies, dealing a setback to a technique that medical experts recommend for colon cancer screening.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new stimulus package seemed to defy the laws of physics in Washington, where numbers don’t often go down.

headline.main: Details of a Trimmer Stimulus Emerge

docs.snippet: The new stimulus package seemed to defy the laws of physics in Washington, where numbers don’t often go down.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and CARL HULSE

docs.lead_paragraph: Increasingly, many older people who live alone are not truly alone. They are being watched by a flurry of new technologies designed to enable them to live independently and avoid expensive trips to the emergency room or nursing homes. Bertha Branch, 78, discovered the power of a system called eNeighbor when she fell to the floor of her Philadelphia apartment late one night without her emergency alert pendant and could not phone for help.

headline.main: Sensors Help Keep the Elderly Safe, and at Home

docs.abstract: Sensors that detect and track motion are among advances in technology that enable elderly people to live independently and avoid expensive trips to emergency room; are connected to central monitoring system that will call person if movement is not detected or is unusual; devices are expensive, remain largely unproven and are not usually covered by government or private insurance plans; doctors are not trained to treat patients using remote data and have no mechanism to be paid for doing so; devices include motion sensors, pill compliance detectors and wireless devices that transmit data on blood pressure, weight, oxygen and glucose levels; may have unintended consequences, substituting electronic measurements for face-to-face contact with doctors, nurses and family members; profile of Bertha Branch who lives alone and claims she would not be able to without system; photos (M)
docs.snippet: Increasingly, many older people who live alone are not truly alone. They are being watched by a flurry of new technologies designed to enable them to live independently and avoid expensive trips to the emergency room or nursing homes.      Bertha...

docs.lead_paragraph: A Houston company run by a colorful billionaire with a penchant for cricket appears to be drawing scrutiny from regulators for its remarkably high and consistent returns.

headline.main: Houston Firm Said to Draw Inquiry Over C.D.'s

docs.abstract: A Houston company run by a colorful billionaire with a penchant for cricket appears to be drawing scrutiny from regulators for its remarkably high and consistent returns. docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 100 federal banking regulators descended on Citigroup in New York on Wednesday morning. Dozens more fanned out through Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and other big banks across the nation.

headline.main: Bank Test May Expand U.S. Regulators' Role

docs.abstract: Nearly 100 federal banking regulators descended on Citigroup in New York on Wednesday morning. Dozens more fanned out through Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and other big banks across the nation. It was just another workday. For years, regulators have embedded themselves inside the nation's major banks to monitor their financial health. But now these [...]
